channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CEOs are bullish but nervous: David Solomon’s Davos readout on deregulation and ‘shotgun’ policy
item.description: Ahead of his own flight to Davos, CEO David Solomon sat with the Goldman Sachs Exchanges podcast for a temperature check.

item.title: The U.S. was ‘the operating system of the world,’ Scott Galloway says, but now ‘the American brand is chaos, corruption, and coercion’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: How Amazon’s Big Box Store Plans Will Hit Local Businesses
item.description: The e-commerce giant wants to take on giant brick and mortar rivals with a 229,000-square-foot location south of Chicago, but its strategy will also h...

item.title: How to Use the 3-3-3 Method to Get a Lot More Done and Feel a Lot Less Pressured
item.description: Feel like following a rigid schedule does your output more harm than good? Try this instead.

item.title: Wall Street celebrates the end of Trump’s Greenland tariff threats and expects the Supreme Court will kill the rest of them
item.description: It's like the last few days never happened.

item.title: LEGO’s Secret: How the Courage to Say ‘No’ Led to Winning
item.description: In the world of business, boldness is often associated with addition: launching new ventures, entering new markets, and pursuing expansive growth. But...

item.title: How AI is redefining accuracy at the X Games

item.title: Three sales secrets from the stage that translate into everyday leadership
item.description: I like to say that my job as a charity auctioneer is the ultimate sales role. I stand onstage night after night encouraging people to give money, play...

item.title: Why you should stop relying on self-discipline and do this instead
item.description: We hear a lot about self-discipline in today’s productivity-obsessed culture . And the message is usually that it’s the cure for economic insecurity a...

item.title: Your Fully AI-Written Emails Are Making It Weird
item.description: Asking the new tech to draft routine correspondence is fine, but leaving it all to the bots could damage your company’s reputation.

item.title: Demis Hassabis, and how AI just might wrangle our molecular universe
item.description: This week, Fortune published a magazine feature looking inside Demis Hassabis’s Isomorphic Labs.

item.title: No ‘job apocalypse’: Goldman Sachs CEO denies the AI hiring nightmare is real
item.description: "Technology has been disrupting jobs, changing the way people work, destroying jobs ... for decades," David Solomon says.

item.title: You can finally see the Met Opera outside NYC: These movie theaters are showing ‘Kavalier and Clay’ this weekend
item.description: If one of your New Year’s resolutions was to spend less time on devices and get more “cultured,” the Metropolitan Opera is here to help—even if you do...

item.title: Oprah Winfrey Says Long-Term Success and Happiness Come Down to 1 Timeless Principle
item.description: Why life and work feel more meaningful when you stop going It alone, says Oprah.
